term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - effectively infinite thickness in flame spectroscopy
term.title: effectively infinite thickness

item.text: Solid or liquid samples of one gram or more are generally used in X-ray spectroscopy. If the sample is thick enough so that the intensity of characteristic fluorescent radiation is not significantly modified by an increase in thickness, the sample is described as a bulk sample of effectively infinite thickness.
